column4: Okay, I need some help. Whenever I boot my computer with my webcam plugged in, I can't operate my webcam. When I unplug it, khubd runs my computer up to 100% cpu usage, and i have no usb usage. How can I fix this?
It sounds as if your webcam model isn't properly supported
when I plug it in after my computer's turned on, it operates fine.
Hmm, sounds like a driver issue then... have you checked with the maintainers of the webcam drivers?
no, I haven't. I just plugged it in when I got it, and it worked so i didn't question it. im not even sure who makes the drivers

Best thing to do is "lshw" and look for your webcam. There you'll find a line for each device that reads "configuration: driver=XXXXXX". Search for XXXXX on Google and you should be able to trace the driver writers
Or you could just search Google for "linux" and the webcam model
that would probably work better, seeing as how my webcam isn't recognized right now.
god, i really don't feel like rebooting lol.
why do you need to reboot?
Can't you unload the driver manually?
If the reason to reboot is to kill the driver, I would think so :)
how do i find the module name?
Refer to my previous comment about using lshw :)
